title: Safe Movement in Snake Territory
brief: Move safely through areas with venomous snakes to avoid dangerous encounters.
steps: Step 1: Walk carefully and watch where you step at all times.
Step 2: Step onto logs rather than over them, looking before moving on.
Step 3: Look closely around fruit trees and water sources before approaching.
Step 4: Use sticks to turn logs and rocks, never use hands.
Step 5: Wear proper footgear, especially important during night movement.
Step 6: Carefully check bedding, shelter, and clothing before use.
warnings: Snakes cannot close their eyes, so you cannot tell if they are sleeping.
Some species like mambas, cobras, and bushmasters will attack aggressively when cornered.
Never tease, molest, or harass snakes even if they appear dead.
Warm sleeping bodies can occasionally attract snakes seeking heat.
